description.value:
Trigger A Small or larger creature walks into a quagmire.

Effect The triggering creature sinks into the quagmire up to its waist. The quagmire rolls initiative if it hasn't already.

details.description: A patch of treacherous bog attempts to submerge creatures that step onto it.
details.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:15|name:Disturb Surface|traits:secret,action:sense-direction,exploration] (trained) to disturb the surface and make the quagmire plainly visible
details.reset: The hazard still submerges anyone who walks in, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 24 hours
details.routine:
(1 action) On its initiative, the quagmire pulls each creature within it 1 square toward the center of the quagmire and 1 step further submerged; a creature that is submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature that is submerged up to its neck is pulled under and has to hold its breath to avoid suffocation.

A creature in the quagmire can attempt a @Check[type:athletics|dc:17|name:Swim Out of Quagmire|traits:environmental,hazard,action:swim] check to Swim to either raise itself by 1 step if its submerged to its neck or worse, or to swim out of the quagmire if its submerged up to only its waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down 1 step. A creature that Swims out of the quagmire escapes the hazard and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Prone] adjacent to the quagmire. Other creatures can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Aid] the creature, typically by using a rope or similar tool, or attempt to pull a creature within their reach out with a @Check[type:athletics|dc:17|name:Pull Out of Quagmire] check, with the same results as if the creature attempted the check.

source.value: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-08: Revolution on the Riverside
